parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the ECG finding category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the ECG finding?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for ECG
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not an ECG or specific ECG test was done.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned ECG measurement, series of ECG measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: ECG Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF= "N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF = "Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: EGPERF

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGREPNUM

fields.completionInstructions: Record which repetition of the ECG this is.
fields.definition: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a timepoint, within a visit; multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).
fields.implementationNotes: If there are multiple ECGs, this is used to record in which order this ECG occurred.
fields.label: ECG Repetition Number
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGREPNUM
fields.questionText: Which repetition of the ECG is this?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGREFID

fields.definition: An internal or external identifier of the ECG (e.g., waveform number).
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer if this reference ID happens to be available to the site at the time of collection. It can also be used to link the clinical significance assessment to the proper record in the electronic data. (e.g., UUID for external waveform file, session number automatically generated by electronic equipment).
fields.label: ECG Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: EGREFID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71151

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGMETHOD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method used for the ECG.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One possible condition is the method used to collect or calculate the ECG data. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.
fields.label: Method of ECG Test
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the ECG?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90013

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGLEAD

self.title: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement

fields.completionInstructions: Record which lead was used for this measurement.
fields.definition: The lead used for the measurement (e.g., "LEAD I", "LEAD II", "LEAD III", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1")
fields.implementationNotes: This is used when more specificity for the location is desired for the ECG data.
fields.label: ECG Lead Location Used for Measurement
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGLEAD
fields.questionText: Which lead location was used for this measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGPOS

fields.completionInstructions: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.
fields.definition: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement.
fields.implementationNotes:
Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: 
 * Position of the subject is provided as part of the electronic data. 
 * Position of the subject is not pertinent to the protocol. 
 * The protocol specifies only 1 possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.
fields.label: ECG Position of Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EGPOS
fields.questionText: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date the ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date the ECG was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: ECG Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EGDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the ECG?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: ECG Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time-point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.
fields.name: EGTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Central Reading.EGTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.
fields.label: ECG Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: EGTIM
fields.questionText: What was the time the ECG was collected?
